result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Favro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Favro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
2:15 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over file, has received a plea questionnaire.  Atty Privat recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge.  Defendant concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  60 days county jail, (with huber if revoked) stayed and places the defendant on probation for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.

11:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Attorney Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  State has received a copy of the doctors report.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the doctor's report.  Defendant believes that she is competent.  Court finds that based upon the doctor's report the defendant is competent. Court will set for hearing in approx 30 days - April 13, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:10 a.m.
to DA Christenson with copy of the competency report
to defendant with copy of competency report
Fax Cover Sheet w/documents faxed to WFU

ADDRESS INFO for Nicole M Favro - per defendant's mother
Current: 501 Dartford Rd, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 01-27-2015)
Prior: 503 Fairview Ct, Wautoma, WI 54982
Defendant is to take any medication that has been prescribed by a doctor.
Defendant is to take any medication that has been prescribed by a doctor.

2:58 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court orders competency evaluation be done.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to take any medication that has been prescribed by a doctor.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 60 days.

Court adjourned at 3:01 p.m.
